intro: Aristega laevifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf aristega, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are smooth and glossy on both sides. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
